vo-dml:model.name: execbroker
vo-dml:model.description: the data model for execution broker
vo-dml:model.author: Dave Morris

primitiveType.name: ISO8601Instant
primitiveType.description: A regular expression filter for an ISO 8601 instant. TODO Add timezone.

primitiveType.name: ISO8601Duration
primitiveType.description: A regular expression filter for an ISO 8601 duration.

primitiveType.name: ISO8601Interval
primitiveType.description: A regular expression filter for an ISO 8601 interval. Generated by ChatGPT See https://chatgpt.com/share/68975beb-1298-8008-b439-a0cd06b636cf

dataType.name: DockerPlatformSpec
dataType.description: Details of the platform the container image is built for. Debatable whether we need to have this here. The information will be in the container, and the platform will probably need to check it anyway to make sure. So why have the duplicate information ?

attribute.name: architecture
attribute.description: The CPU architecture the image is built for. The default is `amd64`.

attribute.name: os
attribute.description: The operating system the image is built for. The default is `linux`.

dataType.name: NameValueMap
dataType.description: A map of name->value properties. See https://swagger.io/docs/specification/data-models/dictionaries/

dataType.name: DockerInternalPort
dataType.description: Details of an internal network port on a container.

attribute.name: port
attribute.description: The port number on the container to publish. This should be defined as part of the description of the executable.

dataType.name: DockerExternalPort
dataType.description: Details of an external network port accessible from outside.

attribute.name: port
attribute.description: The port number of the external interface. The service will populate this value when it sets up the execution.

attribute.name: addresses
attribute.description: A list of public hostnames or IPv4 or IPv6 addresses for the external interface. The service will populate this list when it sets up the execution.

dataType.name: SimpleComputeCores
dataType.description: The number of CPU cores requested by the user. The minimum represents the lower limit that the excution requires. The maximum represents the highest number of cores that the excution can use.

dataType.name: SimpleComputeMemory
dataType.description: The amount of memory requested by the user. The minimum represents the lower limit that the excution requires. The maximum represents the highest amount of memory that the excution can use. All values are given in multiples of 'GiB'.

dataType.name: SimpleStorageSize
dataType.description: The size of storage requested. The minimum represents the minimum size the excution requires. The maximum represents the maximum size that the excution can use. All values are given in multiples of 'GiB'.

dataType.name: RucioDataResourceBlock
dataType.description: A reusable block describing a data resource in a Rucio storage system.

attribute.name: endpoint
attribute.description: The endpoint address of the Rucio service.

attribute.name: scope
attribute.description: The Rucio scope.

attribute.name: object
attribute.description: The target object name.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The Rucio data object type.

objectType.name: ExecutionSessionResponseFour
objectType.description: Container class for ExecutionSession responses.

objectType.name: AbstractExecutable
objectType.description: Abstract base class for executables.

objectType.name: DockerImageSpec
objectType.description: Details of the container image.

attribute.name: locations
attribute.description: An array of repository locations. {repository}/{namespace}/{container}:{tag} e.g. ghcr.io/ivoa/oligia-webtop:ubuntu-2022.01.13

attribute.name: digest
attribute.description: Images that use the v2 or later format have a content-addressable identifier called a digest. As long as the input used to generate the image is unchanged, the digest value is predictable. The digest is generated as a sha256 checksum when the image is built. The digest can be used to verify the contents of an image.

objectType.name: DockerNetworkPort
objectType.description: Details of a network port on the container made available for connection from outside.

attribute.name: access
attribute.description: A flag to indicate whether this port should be listed in the access methods for the execution.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The network protocol to use, typically one of [UDP, TCP, HTTP, HTTPS], with a default of `TCP`. This should be defined as part of the description of the executable supplied by the client. The `HTTP` and `HTTPS` values further specify the protocol to use on top of `TCP`. Specifying `HTTPS` may help to meet firewall restrictions at some sites.

attribute.name: path
attribute.description: The path component of an access URL. This should be defined as part of the description of the executable supplied by the client. This can be used to provide the path of a notebook within a JupyterNotebook container.

objectType.name: DockerNetworkSpec
objectType.description: Details of the network access available to the container.

composition.name: ports
composition.description: An array of network ports to publish.

objectType.name: DockerContainer
objectType.description: Details for a Docker or OCI container executable. See https://opencontainers.org/

attribute.name: privileged
attribute.description: Set the privileged flag on execution. The default is `false`. See https://docs.docker.com/reference/cli/docker/container/run/#privileged.

attribute.name: entrypoint
attribute.description: Overwrite the default ENTRYPOINT of the image.

attribute.name: environment
attribute.description: A name => value map of environment variables to pass to the container.

composition.name: network
composition.description: Details of the network access available to the container.

objectType.name: SingularityContainer
objectType.description: Details for a Singularity container executable. See https://docs.sylabs.io/guides/latest/user-guide/

attribute.name: location
attribute.description: The URL to download the container image from.

objectType.name: JupyterNotebook
objectType.description: Details for a Jupyter notebook executable. See https://jupyter.org/

attribute.name: location
attribute.description: The URL of the notebook. TODO - This needs to take into account different ways of referring to a notebook.

objectType.name: MessageItem
objectType.description: A log message based on the Message Templates standard. https://messagetemplates.org/

attribute.name: kind
attribute.description: The message type identifier. Typically a URL pointing to a human readable description of the message.

attribute.name: time
attribute.description: The date and time of the message.

attribute.name: level
attribute.description: The message level.

attribute.name: template
attribute.description: The message template.

attribute.name: values
attribute.description: A map of name->value properties.

attribute.name: message
attribute.description: The resulting message.

objectType.name: AbstractOption
objectType.description: Abstract base class for describing options. This includes the `type` discriminator and the target `path` to update.

attribute.name: kind
attribute.description: The kind of option.

attribute.name: path
attribute.description: The path this option applies to.

objectType.name: StringValueOption
objectType.description: A simple string value option. This option enables the client to set a string value pointed to by the path.

attribute.name: pattern
attribute.description: A regular expression pattern restricting the value.

objectType.name: EnumValueOption
objectType.description: A simple enum value option. This option enables the client to set an enum value pointed to by the path.

attribute.name: values
attribute.description: The list of available options.

objectType.name: IntegerValueOption
objectType.description: A simple integer value option. This option enables the client to set an integer value pointed to by the path.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: The minimum value that can be set.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: The maximum value that can be set.

attribute.name: units
attribute.description: The units used for the maximum and minimum values and the default units used for the update. The client may specify different units in the update if they need to.

objectType.name: IntegerDeltaOption
objectType.description: A simple integer delta option. This option enables the client to increment or decrement an integer value pointed to by the path.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: The minimum change that can be applied.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: The maximum change that can be applied.

attribute.name: units
attribute.description: The units used for the maximum and minimum values and the default units used for the update. The client may specify different units in the update if they need to.

objectType.name: ComponentMetadata
objectType.description: A metadata block for our components. This includes a name, a UUID identifier, a URL, and lists of the messages and options.

attribute.name: uuid
attribute.description: A machine readable UUID, assigned when a component is created in a service.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: A human readable name, assigned by the client.

attribute.name: url
attribute.description: The URL to access this component.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A human readable description.

attribute.name: created
attribute.description: The date and time the component was created.

attribute.name: modified
attribute.description: The date and time the component was last modified.

composition.name: messages
composition.description: A list of messages about this component.

composition.name: options
composition.description: A List of options the client can apply to this component.

objectType.name: AbstractComponent
objectType.description: Abstract base class for all our components.

attribute.name: kind
attribute.description: The component type identifier.

objectType.name: LifecycleComponent
objectType.description: A component with a lifecycle.

attribute.name: phase
attribute.description: The lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: schedule
attribute.description: The lifecycle schedule.

objectType.name: AbstractComputeResource
objectType.description: Abstract base class for compute resources.

objectType.name: SimpleComputeResource
objectType.description: A simple compute resource.

attribute.name: volumes
attribute.description: A list of the filesystem volumes to mount.

objectType.name: AbstractStorageResource
objectType.description: Abstract base class for storage resources.

objectType.name: SimpleStorageResource
objectType.description: A simple storage resource.

objectType.name: AbstractVolumeMount
objectType.description: Abstract base class for volume mounts.

objectType.name: SimpleVolumeMount
objectType.description: A simple volume mount.

attribute.name: path
attribute.description: The filesystem mount point.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: The read-write access mode.

attribute.name: cardinality
attribute.description: If cardinality is set to INSTANCE, then this volume-mount will mount a single resource at the location set by path. If cardinality is set to CONTAINER, then this volume-mount will create a directory in the target file system, at the location set by path, and mount the resources within that directory.

attribute.name: resources
attribute.description: A list of the data resources in this volume mount. If cardinality is set to INSTANCE then this list should only contain one resource. If cardinality is set to INSTANCE and this list has more than one resource, it should fail validation. If cardinality is set to CONTAINER then this list may contain more than one resource.

objectType.name: AbstractDataResource
objectType.description: Abstract base class for data resources.

objectType.name: SimpleDataResource
objectType.description: A simple downloadable data resource.

attribute.name: location
attribute.description: The URL of the data to import.

objectType.name: S3DataResource
objectType.description: A data resource in a S3 storage system.

attribute.name: endpoint
attribute.description: The endpoint address of the S3 service.

attribute.name: template
attribute.description: The URL template for the S3 service.

attribute.name: bucket
attribute.description: The target bucket name.

attribute.name: object
attribute.description: The target object name. Leaving this blank will mount the whole bucket as a directory.

objectType.name: RucioDataResource
objectType.description: Metadata describing a data resource in a Rucio storage system.

objectType.name: IvoaObsCoreItem
objectType.description: A row of ObsCore metadata about the resource.

objectType.name: IvoaDataLinkItem
objectType.description: A row of DataLink metadata about the resource.

objectType.name: IvoaDataResourceBlock
objectType.description: The IVOA metadata for the resource.

attribute.name: ivoid
attribute.description: The IVOA data identifier (DID).

composition.name: obscore
composition.description: The ObsCore metadata about the resource.

composition.name: datalink
composition.description: The DataLink metadata about the resource.

objectType.name: IvoaDataResource
objectType.description: Metadata describing an IVOA data resource.

objectType.name: SkaoReplicaItem
objectType.description: Metadata about a replica in an RSE.

attribute.name: rsename
attribute.description: The RSE name.

attribute.name: dataurl
attribute.description: The URL/URI of the object within the RSE.

objectType.name: SkaoDataResourceBlock
objectType.description: A reusable block describing the metadata for a SKAO data resource.

attribute.name: namespace
attribute.description: The DM-API namespace (equivalent to the Rucio scope).

attribute.name: objectname
attribute.description: The DM-API object name.

attribute.name: objecttype
attribute.description: The data object type.

objectType.name: SkaoDataResource
objectType.description: Metadata describing a SKAO data resource in the data lake.

objectType.name: ExecutionRequestComponents
objectType.description: The combination of an executable and the compute, storage, volumes, and data resources it needs.

objectType.name: RequestedScheduleItem
objectType.description: The requested schedule.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: The requested duration.

attribute.name: start
attribute.description: The requested start interval.

objectType.name: RequestedScheduleBlock
objectType.description: The requested schedule.

objectType.name: OfferSetRequest
objectType.description: A request for a set of offers for an execution.

objectType.name: AbstractExecutionSession
objectType.description: Abstract base class for execution sessions.

objectType.name: SimpleExecutionComponents
objectType.description: The combination of an executable and the compute, storage, volumes, and data resources it needs.

objectType.name: SimpleSessionConnector
objectType.description: A connector to interact with the session.

attribute.name: kind
attribute.description: A URI to identify the type of connector.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: A flag to indicate the staus of the access method.

attribute.name: protocol
attribute.description: The access protocol, provided by the server when an offer is made. Typically one of [TCP, HTTP, HTTPS].

attribute.name: location
attribute.description: The access connector URL.

objectType.name: SimpleExecutionSession
objectType.description: A simple execution session.

attribute.name: expires
attribute.description: The date and time when this offer expires. Only valid while the state is OFFERED

composition.name: connectors
composition.description: A list of connectors to interact with the session.

objectType.name: ScheduledExecutionSchedule
objectType.description: An Execution Session schedule.

objectType.name: ScheduledExecutionSession
objectType.description: A scheduled execution session.

objectType.name: OfferSetResponse
objectType.description: A set of executions offered in response to a request, including a uuid, href, and an expiry date for the set.

attribute.name: result
attribute.description: A flag to indicate whether the request can be handled by this service. If service is able to handle the request, then the `result` will be `YES` and the `offers` block should contain one or more offers. If service is not able to handle the request, the `result` will be `NO` and the `messages` block should contain one or more reasons explaining why.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A human readable description.

objectType.name: AbstractUpdate
objectType.description: Abstract base class for updates. This includes the `type` discriminator and the target `path` to update.

attribute.name: kind
attribute.description: The kind of update.

attribute.name: path
attribute.description: The path this update applies to.

objectType.name: StringValueUpdate
objectType.description: A simple string value update.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The string value to use.

objectType.name: EnumValueUpdate
objectType.description: A simple enum value update.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The enum value to use.

objectType.name: IntegerValueUpdate
objectType.description: A simple integer value update.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The integer value to use.

attribute.name: units
attribute.description: The units to use for the value.

objectType.name: IntegerDeltaUpdate
objectType.description: A simple integer delta update. This increments or decrements the target value by the specified amount.

attribute.name: delta
attribute.description: The increment or decrement to apply.

attribute.name: units
attribute.description: The units to use for the change.
